summary: This is an email chain from April 2020 discussing the process for victims of Jeffrey Epstein to apply for compensation through the New York State Office of Victim Services (OVS). It involves coordination between legal staff regarding victim eligibility, required documentation, and treatment referrals.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the initial email attaching an OVS application for a victim and coordinating with others about the process.

persons.name: Randee Kogan
persons.context: Mentioned as the intended treatment provider for a victim if the OVS application is approved.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.context: Copied on the email; the sender indicates having discussed OVS procedures with her.

connections.description: Henderson is coordinating an OVS application for a victim who intends to treat with Kogan if approved.
They are copied on the same email chain and have discussed OVS procedures.

events.title: OVS Application Submission
events.description: Brittany Henderson attaches an OVS application for a victim and sends an email to a colleague.

events.title: Coordination on Victim Compensation
events.description: A colleague responds to Henderson clarifying OVS eligibility rules for Epstein victims and procedures for obtaining verification forms.

locations: 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301
keyFacts: The New York State Office of Victim Services (OVS) is only available for victims whose crimes were committed in New York State.
For victims who have not been interviewed, the legal team may be unable to provide a formal police report or FBI crime verification form required by OVS.
A victim referenced in the email intended to receive treatment from Randee Kogan if her OVS application was approved.
The email indicates established procedures between the legal team and Randee Kogan for requesting victim compensation sessions.
